channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023080172
item.description:
Report E-2023080172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate release from (2) 50-pound poly bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released impacting a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged bags and released product were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080501
item.description:
Report X-2023080501

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: VENTURA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG DISCOVERED ON TAIL END OF TRAILER. PKG DAMAGED AND LEAKING. NO BRACING AROUND PKG. IMPROPERLY LOADED. MANAGER CALLED OUT LEAKING PKG. UPON ARRIVAL, INSPECTION FOUND LIQUID ON SURFACE OF TRAILER. CARTON WET DAMAGED. CONTENTS DENTED AND LEAKING FLUID. DescribePack: DUE TO DAMAGE TO CONTENTS, LEAKAGE CAME FROM CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LIQUID IN TRAILER WAS CLEANED UP WITH AMPHOMAG AND ABSORBENT PADS. DAMAGED HAZMAT PLACED IN HAZBAG AND SALVAGE BIN AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT PROCESSING AREA.

item.title: Report E-2023080142
item.description:
Report E-2023080142

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 5 gallon pails of adhesive (un1133) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 5 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was sable to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080300
item.description:
Report X-2023080300

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-23
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA PERSON WENT TO GET THE LEAKING JERRICAN FROM THE UNLOAD. THE SULFURIC ACID SPLASHED ONTO HER ARM AS SHE PUT IT INTO A TOTE. NO ONE SEEMS TO KNOW EXACTLY HOW THE JERRICAN WAS DAMAGED. DescribePack: THE JERRICAN IS PUNCTURED ON THE BOTTOM AND LEAKING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ABSORBENT WAS USED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILLED ACID.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the unload with a wet outer container. Package was put into a hazmat bag and tote and taken to the hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Dents were found along body of inner container(steel drum/can) that led to small punctures and internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a hazmat bag and tote.

item.description:
Report E-2023080039

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: SAN FRANCISCO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALL NIPPON AIRWAYS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was booked for NH107/19Jul23 SFO-HND, with Hanoi as the destination. The shipment was accepted by ANA and placed on export hold by U.S Customs. Customs removed the black shrink wrap when the discrepancy was discovered later by the ANA cargo agent. It was discovered that one of the skids contained 12 boxes labeled as Class 3 UN1266.

LIDS WERE VENTED ON THE GALLONS BOX WAS ALSO MARKED REFRIGERATE DescribePack: 12 X 12 SIDE OF BOX WAS DETERIORATED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ABSORBENT AND PLASTIC BAG

DescribePack: ONE OF THE CONTETNS CAPS IS LOOSE WITH THE SEAL UNDERNEATH NOT COMPLETELY SEALED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report X-2023070570
item.description:
Report X-2023070570

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE BEGAIN TO LEAK AFTER IT WAS SORTED. PICK OFF MOVED PACKAGE TO GRATE. RESPONDER IN FULL PPE RESPONDED ACCORDING TO DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS. AFTER CLEANING UP WITH CLAY AND APPLYING ACTIVATED CHARCOAL TO SPILL, RESPONDER PLACED PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TRAY AND TAKEN TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
